result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M Damske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
11/17/2015 Hearing held; Court amends judgment to reflect 16 month initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision. Sentence credit of 15 days. Defendant eligible for Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program.

 **4/8/2016 Court hearing held. Sentence credit on 14CF344 amended to reflect 132 days. Court further vacated defendant's previous sentence on 14CM799 and re-sentenced him this date.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety.
- No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests.
-Cooperate with physician and take medication as prescribed.
-Pay supervision fees.

Restitution due during term of probation. The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Court costs due during term of probation.Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: -Sentence credit amended to 132 days.

Defendant Paul M Damske in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant appears by video conference from Oakhill Correctional Institution. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is being re-sentenced 14CM799. Atty. Boaz requests probation term only on 14CM799. Court renders sentence. On 14CF344, Court amends sentence credit to 132 days.
Hearing on April 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Due to calendar congestion and video problems, case to be rescheduled.
Clerk made arrangements for defendant to appear by video for sentencing on 3/22/2016.

Defendant Paul M Damske in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody by video from Oakhill Correctional. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court vacates sentence on 14CM799. Court adjourns case to 3/22/2016 10:00 am for court to re-sentence defendant. Defendant stated he wishes Judge Malloy to sentence him, not another court.

Clerk schedules hearing for 2/29 at 2:00 pm. Copy of defendant's letters from DOC and Defendant also forwarded to Atty. Alme Boaz, who stated she will attend the hearing on 2/29. Clerk make arrangements for defendant to appear by video conference on this court date.
received from defendant regarding sentence,   Scanned and forwarded to Br. 1 clerk
Transcript: Clarification of Sentence   11/17/2015   Terrri Knowles

Defendant Paul M Damske in court, in custody by video conference from Oakhill Correctional.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing to clarify sentence and sentence credit. Defendant also requesting ERP. Defendant statement. Court amends the defendant's sentence to: 14CF344 16 months initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision with 15 days credit. On 14CM799, 4 months initial confinement consecutive and 1 year extended supervision consecutive with 120 days credit. Court grants Earned Release Program. Amended Judgment to be prepared and forwarded to DOC/Prison.
Transcript: Sentencing Hearing   4/28/2015   Terri Knowles

Defendant Paul M Damske in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. A.G. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Alme-Boaz. Closing statements. Court finds restitution amount is the retail value witness has testified to.
Restitution hearing on April 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on April 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Paul M Damske in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters guilty plea to complaint. Court examines defendant and finds him guilty. At time of sentencing, State recommends 3 yrs prison with 1.5 yrs initial confinement and 1.5 yrs extended supervision and restitution. Sentence to run consecutive to any other sentence defendant may be serving. Atty. Alme Boaz requests a restitution hearing before proceeding to sentencing. Bail to continue.  Restitution hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Paul M Damske in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Alme Boaz motion for bail reduction. State opposes bail reduction.  Court denies bail motion.
